intro: Selago thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's selago, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms during the summer months. Selago thomsonii is adapted to arid conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant.
